title: Nifty: Growing Uncertainty May Trigger Sell Off Any Time
text:
On analysis of the movements of , in different time frames, I find that despite the growing hopes on tariff trade tussle between the two major economies of the world for a partial deal during the mid of November 2019; growing fear of economic slowdown gets confirmation after the announcement of weak economic data from China which may keep the whole progress on tariff-trade war front under suspicion. On the other hand, steady prices look evident enough to enhance the skepticism in global equity markets before the upcoming Fed’s meeting on October 29 – 30. Secondly, most of the technical details of the expected Sino-U.S. trade deal are yet to be finalized; before the U.S. President Donald Trump and his Chinese counterpart come forward to seal a final deal. I find that during such a scenario, growing volatility in global equity markets may find sudden sell-off if they sense any negative development on the tariff trade war front.

Finally, I conclude that this 15-month long Sino-U.S. tariff trade tussle has already damaged the global economies up to a greater extent; and may continue to extend bearishness in global equity markets for a long time in future. I find that growing uncertainty may trigger a sudden sell-off in global equity markets. No doubt that despite a bouncing move in U.S. equity markets on Monday may see exhaustive moves in today’s trading session; which will confirm the continuity of a downward trend in during the month of November 2019.
